description: From Italian totalitario (“complete, absolute, totalitarian”)  +‎ -an. Equivalent to totality +‎ -arian.

adjectives.description: totalitarian (comparative more totalitarian, superlative most totalitarian)

entries.meaning: Of or relating to a system of government where the people have virtually no authority and the state wields absolute control of every aspect of the country, socially, financially, and politically.
examples: The divine truth is stronger than totalitarian falsehoods.
